Modal

A classic modal overlay, in which you can include any content you want.

Changelog Modal
Launch Changelog Modal

Changelog

Version 1.0.5 changelog (30 May 2021)

  • You can now save layouts using the new main navigation control.
  • Added Changelog Popup, so you can see what we are adding, changing or improving.

Version 1.0.4 changelog (28 May 2021)

  • Small bug fixes.
  • Added more analytics to help us detect potential issues.

Help us improve

You can help Winnow provide more accurate results by matching company names across different data sources.

Complex Modal
Launch Complex Modal

Drug: Tislelizumab

Identifier and Information

NCT04215978

Phase 1

Status

Recruiting

Study Date

January 30, 2020

E.Completion Date

October 31, 2022

Enrolment Count

68

Study Description

[Brief Title] Safety and Preliminary Effectiveness of BGB-A445 in Combination with Tislelizumab in Participants with Advanced Solid Tumors.

  • Description
  • Eligibility Criteria
  • Outcomes

[Study Description] The purpose of this study is to assess the safety and tolerability of BGB-A445 alone and in combination with Tislelizumab in participants with advanced solid tumors; and to determine the maximum tolerated dose(s) (MTD) or maximum administered doses(s) (MAD) and recommended Phase 2 doses (RP2D) of BGB-A445 alone and in combination with Tislelizumab.

Location(s)

Australia, Western Australia

Linear Clinical Research

Recruiting

St John of God - Subiaco Hospital - Bendat Family Comprehensive Cancer Centre

Not Yet Recruiting

Identifier and Information

Phase 1

Status

Recruiting

Study Date

January 30, 2020

E.Completion Date

October 31, 2022

Enrolment Count

Study Description

[Brief Title] Safety and Preliminary Effectiveness of BGB-A445 in Combination with Tislelizumab in Participants with Advanced Solid Tumors.

  • Description

  • Outcomes

[Study Description] The purpose of this study is to assess the safety and tolerability of BGB-A445 alone and in combination with Tislelizumab in participants with advanced solid tumors; and to determine the maximum tolerated dose(s) (MTD) or maximum administered doses(s) (MAD) and recommended Phase 2 doses (RP2D) of BGB-A445 alone and in combination with Tislelizumab.

Recruiting
